intro: Stenoloma bifidum, commonly known as the bifid stenoloma, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes a variety of grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation in arid environments.
